interviews.title: Graduate • First-role interviews
interviews.subtitle: What entry-level recruiters look for
tips: Prepare 3–4 concise achievement stories using STAR
Quantify outcomes even for coursework and internships
Study the job description; mirror the language

qas.sample: I’m a B.Com graduate who led a campus consulting sprint... now I’m targeting analyst roles where I can use Excel & SQL to model…
On a team project, two members disagreed on scope… I facilitated a brief sync…

interviews.title: Professional • Career-change interviews
interviews.subtitle: Reframe experience; highlight transferable skills
tips: Open with a positioning statement (who you are → where you’re going)
Bridge past roles to target role outcomes with metrics
Pre-empt gaps with ‘what I did to upskill’

qas.sample: After 4 years in operations, I’m moving to product because I’ve shipped internal tools that cut cycle time 22%…
Led cross-team rollout; reduced defects 35% in 2 quarters…

resume.title: Structure & ATS basics
resume.subtitle: Clean layout; one page for grads, up to two for seniors
resume.summary: Use a simple two-column grid sparingly, standard fonts (11–12pt), and consistent spacing. Export to PDF.
dos: Lead bullets with strong verbs (Built, Led, Automated)
Use impact metrics (%, time saved, revenue)
Mirror key phrases from the job description
donts: No photos, heavy graphics, or tables
Don’t list every task — focus on results

examples.heading: Good bullet
examples.text: Automated monthly report in Apps Script, cutting prep time by 6 hours (-80%).

resume.title: Graduates: Projects & internships
resume.subtitle: Make academic work market-ready
resume.summary: Show 2–3 relevant projects with problem → action → impact; place internships above coursework.
dos: Include tools (Excel, Python, Figma) with context
donts: Don’t overfill ‘Objective’ — use a crisp headline
Avoid generic skill dumps without proof
Don’t hide GPA if it strengthens your case

examples.heading: Project bullet
examples.text: Built a Flask API for attendance; reduced manual entry by 90% across 3 classes.

resume.title: Professionals: Impact narrative
resume.subtitle: Translate experience into business outcomes
resume.summary: For each role, pick 3–5 wins tied to KPIs (cost, quality, speed, NPS).
dos: Group bullets under themes (Delivery, Quality, Growth)
Include mentoring, hiring, or training impact
donts: Don’t list outdated tech beyond the last 10 years unless relevant
Don’t repeat the same bullet across roles

examples.heading: Impact bullet
examples.text: Reduced incident MTTR from 140m to 52m by introducing runbooks and weekly postmortems.
